ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This semester in KREN 120, I developed a lot of my writing, speaking, and grammar skills. This semester, I really saw a drastic improvement in my ability to speak and write in Korean, and this was mostly due to the excellent organization and structure of the lessons. I also learned more about Korean culture through korean food, travel, and music.
I continued my knowledge of the Korean languagespeaking, writing, reading, listening.
Additional skills in Korean writing, grammar, and speaking
How to speak of how I did something, formal conversation, have tried, should, need, know how to do. Bettered my speaking, reading and writing skills.
I expanded my knowledge of the Korean language and learned more grammar and vocabulary.
Knowledge in Korean language expanded and improved greatly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths of this class included how well organized and structured the lessons were. I really felt like I had an easy time following what the learning objectives were. Another strength was the choice of vocab. I felt that we learned vocab that we can use easily in daily life. There aren't any weaknesses I can think about nor are there things I can pinpoint as to how the class can be improved.

-Heavy reliance on the textbook is good in the sense that the class is reliable/predictable, but I think the inclusion of more outside material would have a more comprehensive review of the class (eg the TA has stated before the phrases in the textbook sound outdated/less commonly used)
Overall there is a strong emphasis on participation (speaking) in class which is fantastic for building language acquisition
However as stated the reliance on textbook lead to a bit of dullness.

Strengths: It's very structured and I like that I have an idea of what I will need to get done each week before the week has started. There is also always encouragement and equality among the students in class which I like because it makes me feel comfortable and relieves my worry of making mistakes 

Weaknesses: I honestly can't think of any. This was my favorite class this semester.
Strength: very hands on and easy to engage
The course was very engaging and motivating. The teacher made sure everyone was included in the class and encouraged others to participate.
The strengths of this course were the structure and organization of the class lectures.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would highly recommend this course, especially with Professor Back. I learned so much, not only about the Korean language, but also about Korean culture. I also made great friends in the class, and this was partly because Professor Back was a very engaging professor and everyone was very excited to learn from her.

I would absolutely recommend the class if a person is interested in Korean culture or the languageProf. Back makes learning fun. However the language itself is not the easiest, so unless there is at least a slight interest, I would not recommend learning it just to complete the distributional requirements.

Absolutely. If you're interested in learning Korean, the department here is amazing.   is one of the best professors I've ever had and I've improved so much this semester. Definitely would recommend taking Korean, I feel so supported and I've loved it so far.
Yes, very fun and engaging, excited to go everyday

I would highly recommend this course. I learned a lot in this class. Meeting for class everyday gave our class a sense of community, and I've met great people through it with whom I can converse with in Korean now!
Yes! A great course with lots of content and opportunities to grow.
This course would be recommended because of the structure of this class and its ability to help you improve your learning.
